characters: WOULD YOU PLEASE JUST LISTEN TO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We skim above a dark, wild ocean. The camera turns toward lone island, Berk. It is a gigantic shard of rock jutting straight out of the water.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: This, is Berk. It's twelve days North of hopeless, and a few degrees South of freezing to death. It's located solidly on the meridian of misery. The camera drifts over rolling hills to reveal a small village nestled on an outcropping of sea mounts.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: My village. In a word, sturdy. And it's been here for seven generations, but every single building is new. The camera drifts closer, circling.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We have fishing, hunting, and a charming view of the sunsets. The only problems are the pests. You see, most places have mice or mosquitos. We have... Sheep graze peacefully on a hillside. Suddenly one is snatched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A door is pulled open... as a DRAGON swoops directly towa it, BLASTING FIRE. The door is SLAMMED. The fire shoots through the slats of wood, illuminating HICCUP, a gangly teenage Viking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...dragons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reopens the sizzling door, as leaps off of the front porch. He weaves through the erupting mayhem as Vikings p out of the buildings, ready for a fight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010 More dragons swarm in, setting rooftops alight and haulin off sheep.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Most people would leave. Not us. We're Vikings. We have stubbornness issues. Vikings sound the alarm. Viking men and women pour out in the streets, axes in hand. ON HICCUP darting through alleys, staying under eaves, ma his way through the battle.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: My name's Hiccup. Great name, I know. But it's not the worst. Parents believe a hideous name will frighten off gnomes and trolls. Like our charming Viking demeanor wouldn't do that. Dragons sweep back and forth, dodging axes and blasting t Vikings who throw them. A burly warrior gets tossed in an explosion, knocking Hiccup to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arggghhhhh! (cheery, insane) Mornin'! Hiccup gets to his feet and continues to rush past gigant men and women.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Meet the neighbors. Hoark the Haggard...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing out!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Burnthair the Broad...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get inside!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Phlegma the Fierce...

dialogues.speaker: PHLEGMA THE FIERCE
dialogues.text: Get back inside!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: . Ack. He passes a silent ox of a viking, picking his ear.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Yep, just Ack. Enter STOICK, the biggest Viking of all. He yanks Hiccup the path of a strafing dragon and holds aloft to the crow

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hiccup!? (accusingly; to the crowd) What is he doing out again?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing out?! Get inside! The flames light up his scowling face and matted red bear He sets Hiccup down and turns to the sky, searching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Stoick the Vast. Chief of the tribe. They say that when he was a baby he popped a dragon's head clean off of its shoulders. Do I believe it? Stoick grabs a wooden cart and hurls it, knocking the strafing dragon out of the sky.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Yes I do. An EXPLOSION forces Vikings to DUCK. Stoick stands firm, brushing flaming debris off of his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (barking; to his men) What have we got?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gronkles. Nadders. Zipplebacks. Oh, and Hoark saw a Monstrous Nightmare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any Night Furies?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None so far.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hoist the torches! Massive flaming braziers are raised on poles, lighting up night sky... and revealing swirling dragons of all types. Below, Hiccup crosses an open plaza and ducks into an ope building with a tall chimney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He crosses behind a counter, where a peg-legged, one-arme hulk of a Blacksmith reshapes blades with a hammer and to appendage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah! Nice of you to join the party. I thought you'd been carried off. Hiccup dons a leather apron and starts to put away Gobber scattered appendages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who me? Nah, come on! I'm way too muscular for their taste. They wouldn't know what to do with all this. Hiccup strikes a bodybuilder pose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They need toothpicks, don't they? Hiccup gets to work, transferring bent and chipped weapon the forge as Vikings crowd the counter for replacements.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The meathead with attitude and interchangeable hands is Gobber. I've been his apprentice ever since I was little. Well...littler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We move to the lower defenses. We'll counter-attack with the catapults.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010 Armed men rush past, flanking others who carry sheep to safety. Stoick follows up the rear as, overhead, a dragon strafes the rooftops with Napalm-like fire.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: See? Old village. Lots and lots of new houses.

dialogues.speaker: FIRE
dialogues.text: In response, the fire brigade charges through the plaza - four TEENS, tugging a large wooden cask on wheels. From i they fill buckets of water to douse the flames. One among them is a cute, energetic Viking girl. Hiccup leans out of the stall to watch her.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Oh and that's Fishlegs, Snotlout. The twins Ruffnut and Tuffnut. And...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Astrid. A SLOW-MOTION explosion erupts behind her, framing her in sexy ball of fire. The others join her, looking awesome a heroic.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Their job is so much cooler. Hiccup tries to join them as they pass, but he's hooked b Gobber and hoisted back inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, come on. Let me out, please. I need to make my mark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you've made plenty of marks. All in the wrong places.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, two minutes. I'll kill a dragon. My life will get infinitely better. I might even get a date.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't lift a hammer. You can't swing an axe... Gobber grabs a bola (iron balls connected by rope).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010

dialogues.speaker: GOBBER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ... you can't even throw one of these. A Viking runs by and nabs it out of Gobber's hand, hurlin at a dive-bombing Gronkle. The bola binds its legs, sendi it into a heavy crash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ready with the answer) Okay fine, but... He rushes to the back corner of the stall and presents a bizarre, wheel barrow-like contraption.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ... this will throw it for me. Hiccup OPENS the hinged lid of the device. An arm springs equipped with twin bows. They prematurely launch a bola, narrowly missing Gobber... and taking out a Viking at the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arggh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, now this right here is what I'm talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mild calibration issue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hiccup. If you ever want to get out there to fight dragons, you need to stop all... Gobber gestures in Hiccup's general direction.

dialogues.speaker: GOBBER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ... this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But... you just pointed to all of me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes! That's it! Stop being all of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ohhhh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ohhhhh, yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You, sir, are playing a dangerous game. Keeping this much, raw...Vikingness contained.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There will be consequences! Gobber tosses him a sword.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take my chances. Sword. Sharpen. Now. Hiccup takes it begrudgingly and lobs it onto the grindin wheel. He stews... fantasizing...

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: One day I'll get out there. Because killing a dragon is everything around here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nadders land, gathering like seagulls around a seemingly vacant house.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: A Nadder head is sure to get me at least noticed. The Nadders clamber onto the building, tearing the roof a walls apart. Sheep pour out and SCATTER. Elsewhere, hippo-like Gronckles pick drying racks clean o fish and fly off like loaded pelicans.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Gronckles are tough. Taking down one of those would definitely get me a girlfriend. A stealthy, snake-like dragon head peeks over a rooftop, breathing gas into a chimney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: A Zippelback? Exotic, exciting. Two heads, twice the status. A second head pokes through the door and lights it. KABLA The two heads fly through the explosion, their necks zipp together to reveal a single body. It flies past Stoick as he climbs to the top of a CATAPUL TOWER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They found the sheep!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Concentrate fire over the lower bank!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fire! Boulders are catapulted at the corralling Nadders... Just as a huge red dragon whips past, spraying the base o the catapult with sticky fire.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And then there's the Monstrous Nightmare. Only the best Vikings go after those. They have this nasty habit of setting themselves on fire. It emerges from the flames, climbing the catapult with a leering, toothy grin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reload! I'll take care of this. Stoick takes on the Nightmare, face to hammer. Suddenly, a LOUD BALLISTIC MOANING streaks overhead. The catapult crew ducks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON HICCUP, looking up from his work, reacting to the same sound.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: But the ultimate prize is the dragon no one has ever seen. We call it the--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Night Fury! Get down! Vikings everywhere take shelter. The moaning sound BUILDS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Monstrous Nightmare suddenly stops fighting and takes flight. Stoick looks skyward.

dialogues.speaker: JUMP
dialogues.text: KABOOM! The Catapult EXPLODES as though hit by an artille shell... sending Stoick and the crew leaping for their li

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: This thing never steals food, never shows itself, and... The sound recedes, leaving the crippled catapult in flame

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ...never misses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one has ever killed a Night Fury. That's why I'm going to be the first.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE STALL
dialogues.text: Gobber trades his hammer for an axe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man the fort, Hiccup, they need me out there! Gobber pauses. Turns with a threatening glare.

dialogues.speaker: GOBBER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Stay. Put. There. You know what I mean. Gobber charges into the fray, HOLLERING. ON HICCUP, a smirk crosses his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAM! Hiccup pushes his wheeled contraption through a wal clustered Vikings. He weaves through the ongoing mayhem, fast as his legs can carry him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010

dialogues.speaker: VIKING
dialogues.text: Hiccup, where are you going!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come back here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. Be right back!

dialogues.speaker: ON THE PLAIN BELOW
dialogues.text: The Nadders have cornered the house-full of sheep. They c in, ready to spring upon them. Stoick suddenly appears, HURLING FISHING NETS over them. surprised Nadders are caught. Stoick and his men rush in. A Nadder blasts a hole through its net. Stoick leaps onto clamping his thick arms around its head, forcing its jaws shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mind yourselves! The devils still have some juice in them.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE PLAIN ABOVE
dialogues.text: Hiccup reaches a cliff overlooking the smoking CATAPULT a drops the handles to the ground. He cranks several levers unfolding and then cocking the bowed arms of his contrapt He drops a bola onto a chamber and then pivots the weapon a gimbal head toward the dark sky. He listens, with his eye pressed to the scope, hand poise the trigger. He hears the NIGHT FURY approaching... and t his aim to the defense tower. It closes in for the final strike, completely camouflaged in the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. Give me something to shoot at, give me something to shoot at. KABLAM! The tower topples. The blast of fire illuminates dragon for a split second. Hiccup pulls the trigger. KERTHUNK! The flexed arms SNAP forward, springing the wea off the ground. The bola disappears into the sky, followe a WHACK and a SCREECH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (surprised, then elated) Oh I hit it! Yes, I hit it! Did anybody see that? Hiccup's victory is short-lived. A Monstrous Nightmare appears, slithering up over the lip of the cliff.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Except for you. ON STOICK, holding down the netted Nadders. He hears a familiar HOLLER and looks up to see... HICCUP running through the PLAZA, SCREAMING, with the NIGHTMARE fast on his heels. Alarmed, Stoick abandons the Nadders and runs off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to his men, re: the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DO NOT let them escape!

dialogues.speaker: IN THE PLAZA
dialogues.text: Vikings scatter as Hiccup dodges a near fatal blast. The Nightmare's sticky, Napalm-like fire splashes up onto buildings, setting them alight. Hiccup ducks behind the last standing brazier -- the only shelter available. The Nightmare blasts it, spraying fire around him. Hiccup peers around the smoldering post. No s of the Nightmare. He turns back to find it leering at him, blocking his esc It takes a deep breath. Hiccup is finished. Suddenly, Stoick LEAPS between them, tackling the Nightma to the ground. They tumble and wrestle, resuming their earlier fight. The Nightmare tries to toast him, but only coughs up smoke.

dialogues.speaker: STOICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're all out. He smashes the Nightmare repeatedly in the face, driving away. It takes to the air and disappears. Winded, Stoick turns to Hiccup.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Oh, and there's one more thing you need to know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010 The burnt brazier pole collapses, sending the massive iro basket crashing. It bounces down the hill, destroying as goes and scattering the Vikings who were holding down the netted Nadders. The freed dragons escape... with several sheep in tow.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sorry, dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The escaped Nadders fly past with sheep in their clutches The raid is over. The dragons have clearly won. The murmuring crowd eyes Stoick, awaiting his response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, but I hit a Night Fury. Stoick grabs Hiccup by the back scruff of his collar and hauls him away, fuming with embarrassment.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's not like the last few times, Dad. I mean I really actually hit it. You guys were busy and I had a very clear shot. It went down, just off Raven Point. Let's get a search party out there, before it--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --STOP! Just....stop. He releases Hiccup. Everyone goes silent, staring expectantly.

dialogues.speaker: STOICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Every time you step outside, disaster follows. Can you not see that I have bigger problems? Winter's almost here and I have an entire village to feed! Hiccup looks around. All eyes are upon him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Between you and me, the village could do with a little less feeding, don't ya think? A few rotund Vikings stir self-consciously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't a joke, Hiccup!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why can't you follow the simplest orders?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't stop myself. I see a dragon and I have to just... kill it, you know? It's who I am, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are many things, Hiccup. But a dragon killer is not one of them. Sting. Hiccup looks around to see many nods of agreement.

dialogues.speaker: STOICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Get back to the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make sure he gets there. I have his mess to clean up. Stoick lumbers off in the opposite direction. Gobber leads Hiccup through the walk of shame. They pass teen fire brigade as they snicker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quite the performance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never seen anyone mess up that badly. That helped!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, thank you. I was trying, so... Hiccup avoids Astrid's glare and heads up toward a large house, standing prominently on the hill above the others.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I really did hit one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, Hiccup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He never listens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it runs in the family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And when he does, it's always with this... disappointed scowl. Like someone skimped on the meat in his sandwich.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, barmaid. I'm afraid you brought me the wrong offspring. I ordered an extra large boy with beefy arms. Extra guts and glory on the side. This here. This is a talking fish bone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're thinking about this all wrong. It's not so much what you look like. It's what's inside that he can't stand. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, for summing that up. They reach the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, the point is, stop trying so hard to be something you're not. Hiccup SIGHS heavily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want to be one of you guys. Gobber eyes him sympathetically. Hiccup turns and goes through the front door. And straight out the back door. He hurries off into the woods, determined.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A noisy din of PROTESTING VOICES leads to... STOICK, glowering in the firelight. Surrounded by his men

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Either we finish them or they'll finish us! It's the only way we'll be rid of them! If we find the nest and destroy it, the dragons will leave. They'll find another home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010 He sinks his blade into a... LARGE NAUTICAL MAP, spread out on the table... the blade pierces the middle of an uncharted corner, swirling with painted sea monsters and dragons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One more search. Before the ice sets in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those ships never come back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're Vikings. It's an occupational hazard. Now who's with me? Stoick throws up his fist. No one follows. The crowds shi in restless silence. Head scratches. Eyes averted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Today's not good for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've gotta do my axe returns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright. Those who stay will look after Hiccup. Hands jut into the air, volunteers galore. Enthusiastic murmurs of prep and packing fill the room.

dialogues.speaker: PHLEGMA THE FIERCE
dialogues.text: To the ships!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm with you Stoick!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's more like it. The Vikings rush for the door, leaving Gobber and Stoick alone. Gobber gulps back the contents of his tankard attachment and scrapes back the bench.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll pack my undies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I need you to stay and train some new recruits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, perfect. And while I'm busy, Hiccup can cover the stall. Molten steel, razor sharp blades, lots of time to himself...what could possibly go wrong? Stoick sinks onto the bench beside Gobber, his brow burde

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What am I going to do with him Gobber?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put him in training with the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So am I. Stoick turns to him, glaring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'd be killed before you let the first dragon out of its cage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you don't know that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do know that, actually.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, actually I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No you don't!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen! You know what he's like. From the time he could crawl he's been...different. He doesn't listen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Has the attention span of a sparrow. I take him fishing and he goes hunting for... for trolls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trolls exist! They steal your socks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But only the left ones. What's with that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I was a boy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh here we go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My father told me to bang my head against a rock and I did it. I thought it was crazy, but I didn't question him. And you know what happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a headache.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That rock split in two. It taught me what a Viking could do, Gobber. He could crush mountains, level forests, tame seas! Even as a boy, I knew what I was, what I had to become.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hiccup is not that boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't stop him, Stoick. You can only prepare him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I know it seems hopeless. But the truth is you won't always be around to protect him. He's going to get out there again. He's probably out there now. ON STOICK, as Gobber's words hit their mark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010 A drawn map of the island, covered in X's. Hiccup looks up from it and peeks over a gorge, expectant Sees nothing. He adds another 'X' to the page, then scratches his penci over the whole map in frustration. He snaps the book clos and pockets it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uggh, the gods hate me. Some people lose their knife or their mug. No, not me. I manage to lose an entire dragon. Hiccup WHACKS a low-hanging branch. It SNAPS back at him, hitting him in the face. He looks up to see a snapped tre trunk. His eyes follow it to a long trench of up-turned earth. He follows it to a downed, black dragon, its body and tai tangled in a bola. It appears dead. Hiccup approaches, beaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh wow. I did it. I did it. This fixes everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes! He strikes a victory pose, planting his foot on the falle Night Fury.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I have brought down this mighty beast! It suddenly shifts.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Whoa! Hiccup springs back, terrified. He turns his blade on it. Rattled, Hiccup creeps along the length of the weak, woun dragon, dagger poised to strike. As he reaches the head, Hiccup finds the Night Fury stari coldly at him. Hiccup tries to look away, but he's drawn to its unnerving, unflinching stare. With the dragon safety tangled in the ropes, Hiccup jabs his dagger, puffing himself up with false bravado.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm going to kill you, Dragon. I'm gonna cut out your heart and take it to my father. I'm a Viking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am a VIKING! Hiccup raises the dagger, determined to prove his Viking- ness. The dragon's labored breathing breaks Hiccup's clen concentration. He opens an eye, uncertainty leaking throu The dragon holds the stare. Something profound is exchang Finally, the Night Fury closes its eye and lowers its hea resigned to its fate. Hiccup tries to go through with it, holding the dagger aloft... fighting himself... until finally lowering it wi frustrated sigh. He looks over the dragon's chaffed rope wounds.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (muttered, ashamed) I did this. He turns to leave. Pauses. And glances back at the dragon chest heaving. Hiccup GRUMBLES. He checks over his shoulder to ensure th no one is watching... then hurries back to cut the ropes. The Night Fury's eye shoots open. With the dragon watchin his every move, Hiccup hurriedly saws through the bola ro As the last rope falls free, the Night Fury suddenly POUN In a blur, the dragon is upon him, pinning Hiccup down, grazing his neck. Looking like it's about to kill him. Hi is paralyzed. The dragon's breath ruffles his hair. Hiccu opens his eyes to find the Night Fury's wolf-like stare boring into him. The exchange is intense, profound. The dragon draws a deep breath, as though it's about to t him, then lets out an ear-piercing scream instead. It tur and takes flight, flapping violently through the canopy o trees. It bashes against a nearby mountain side, recovers and drops out of view some distance away. Winded, Hiccup struggles to his feet, staggers a few step collapses to his knees, and faints.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hiccup enters to see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010 STOICK, seated on a thick slice of tree-trunk. He is slou over the fire-pit, stirring the coals with his axe. Ember waft around his beard. Hiccup tries to sneak past, up the stairs to his room. St seems none the wiser, when...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hiccup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad. Uh... Stoick stands, takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I, uh... I have to talk to you, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to speak with you too, son. Hiccup and Stoick STRAIGHTEN at the same moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've decided I don't want to I think it's time you learn fight dragons. to fight dragons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? What?

dialogues.speaker: STOICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You go first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you go first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright. You get your wish. Dragon training. You start in the morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh man, I should've gone first. Uh, 'cause I was thinking, you know we have a surplus of dragon-fighting Vikings, but do we have enough bread-making Vikings, or small home

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --You'll need this. Stoick hands Hiccup his axe. Hiccup avoids taking it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to fight dragons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. Yes, you do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rephrase. Dad I can't kill dragons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you will kill dragons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm really very extra sure that I won't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's time Hiccup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you not hear me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is serious son! Stoick forces the axe into Hiccup's hands. Its weight dra him down. He looks up to see Stoick under-lit with fireli

dialogues.speaker: STOICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: When you carry this axe... you carry all of us with you. Which means you walk like us. You talk like us. You think like us. No more of...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: specifically at Hiccup) ... this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just gestured to all of me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This conversation is feeling very one-sided.

dialogues.speaker: DEAL
dialogues.text: Hiccup glances at the axe in his hands. It's a no-win argument.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deal. Satisfied, Stoick grabs his helmet and duffel bag... and heads for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Train hard. I'll be back. Probably.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'll be here. Maybe. Stoick heads out the door, leaving Hiccup holding the axe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gobber raises a massive iron gate at the entrance of a va stone arena.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to dragon training! The recruits file through the gate, and out onto the aren floor. They take it in like gladiators entering the colosseum. The walls are covered in scorched silhouettes blasted Vikings. It's a grim yet awe-inspiring place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No turning back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope I get some serious burns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm hoping for some mauling, like on my shoulder or lower back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it's only fun if you get a scar out of it.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Yeah, no kidding, right? Pain. Love it. The recruits turn to see Hiccup behind them. Groans all around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh great. Who let him in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get started! The recruit who does best will win the honor of killing his first dragon in front of the entire village.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hiccup already killed a Night Fury, so does that disqualify him or...? The recruits LAUGH and chatter in the background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I transfer to the class with the cool Vikings? Gobber throws a supportive arm around Hiccup and ushers h along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cheery, in confidence) Don't worry. You're small and you're weak. That'll make you less of a target. They'll see you as sick or insane and go after the more Viking-like teens instead. GOBBER stick him in line with the others and continues on toward five massive reinforced doors. Terrible ROARS and BELLOWS issue from within.

dialogues.speaker: GOBBER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Behind these doors are just a few of the many species you will learn to fight. Fishlegs bounces and giggles with excitement, barely able contain himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Deadly Nadder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under his breath) Speed eight. Armor sixteen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hideous Zippleback.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plus eleven stealth. Times two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Monstrous Nightmare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Firepower fifteen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Terrible Terror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Attack eight. Venom twelve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And...the Gronckle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly; to himself) Jaw strength, eight. Gobber pulls a lever, raising the cross beam on the last the doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa, wait! Aren't you gonna teach us first!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe in learning on the job. BAM! A GRONCKLE thunders out of its cave, charging into t ring like an irate rhino. The recruits scramble in every direction. Except for Ruff and Tuffnut who rush toward it, like pumped-up rodeo clow

dialogues.speaker: GOBBER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Today is about survival. If you get blasted, you're dead. Quick, what's the first thing you're going to need?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A doctor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plus five speed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shield.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shields. Go. The recruits scramble for shields, finding them scattered around the ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010

dialogues.speaker: GOBBER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Your most important piece of equipment is your shield. If you must make a choice between a sword or a shield, take the shield. Hiccup STRUGGLES to lift his. Gobber helps him and sends running. Ruff and Tuff stand amidst a dozen shields. But only one a skull painted on it. They both grab it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get your hands off my shield!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are like a million shields!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take that one, it has a flower on it. Girls like flowers. Ruffnut uses the shield to BASH Tuffnut in the face. He doesn't let go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooops, now this one has blood on it. The Gronckle takes aim at the distracted twins. Blam! The shield is blasted out of both of their hands. Tuff and Ru SPIN like tops and go down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuffnut, Ruffnut, you're out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?! The Gronckle scoops up a pile of rocks and SWALLOWS them back. The teens gather on the far side of the ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those shields are good for another thing. Noise. Make lots of it to throw off a dragon's aim. The kids scoop up weapons and begin hammering on their shields. The Gronckle shakes its head at the clatter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010 GRONCKLE'S POV - the teens targets become blurry and scrambled. It's working.

dialogues.speaker: GOBBER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: All dragons have a limited number of shots. How many does a Gronckle have?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, six.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Correct, six. That's one for each of you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really don't think my parents

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAM! Fishlegs has his shield blasted away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fishlegs, out. Gobber spots Hiccup hiding from the Gronckle's molten slu

dialogues.speaker: GOBBER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hiccup, get in there! ON ASTRID bouncing on her heels, ready to dodge a blast. Snotlout appears, trying to hit on her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So anyway I'm moving into my parents' basement. You should come by sometime to work out. You look like you work out-- She cartwheels out of the way, allowing a shot to shoot p her and hit Snotlout's shield. He's blasted onto his back

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snotlout! You're done! Astrid ROLLS to a stop beside Hiccup, who stirs awkwardly trying to look cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, I guess it's just you and me huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Just you. Astrid ROLLS away. A split-second later a lava slug knock Hiccup's shield clear off of his arm. Hiccup is exposed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One shot left! Hiccup panics and chases after his shield as it rolls acr the ring. The sudden movement sends the Gronckle chasing after him, leaving Astrid in the clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hiccup! The Gronckle drives straight toward Hiccup, pinning him against the wall. It opens its mouth and cocks its tail, ready to fire point-blank. Gobber lunges in and hooks the Gronckle's mouth at the la second, causing its head to jerk back and fire against th stone wall above Hiccup's head.

dialogues.speaker: GOBBER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (rattled, but masking it) And that's six! Gobber wrestles the irate Gronckle back into his pen.

dialogues.speaker: GOBBER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Go back to bed, ya overgrown sausage! You'll get another chance, don't you worry. Slam! Lock. Gobber turns to the recruits.

dialogues.speaker: GOBBER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Remember... a dragon will always, (with a stern look to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: always go for the kill. He hoists Hiccup to his feet and walks off. Hiccup looks overhead to see a steaming pit in the solid stone wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HICCUP, battered after another disastrous day in the ring studies the remnants of the discarded bola... revealing t he's back at the scene of the crime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So...why didn't you? He drops the bola and presses on in the direction it flew off. He drops into a rocky crevice and follows it to an.. ISOLATED COVE complete with a pristine spring pool. He sc the high stone walls... then notices a single black SCALE the ground. He crouches and picks it up, studying it.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Well this was stupid. SUDDENLY, the NIGHT FURY blasts past him. Hiccup recoils, watching the massive beast struggle to climb the walls. I flaps violently, then peels away to a rough landing. The dragon is trapped. Hiccup grins, excited to see it again, and slips closer. He watches as the dragon, exhausted and frustrated, leaps into the air, beating its wings furiously. Again and agai it rolls uncontrolled and CRASHES heavily. As if remembering to snap a photo, Hiccup pulls a leather bound book and flips past drawings of weapons to a blank page. He sketches the dragon quickly, desperate to record image. The Fury claws at the steep rock walls, trying climb out the cove. It SLIPS and falls hard, crushing several sapli The Fury rolls back to his feet and slowly crawls to the water's edge. He spots fish in the shallow water and snap them... but comes up empty. He lowers his head, looking weakened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you just...fly away? ON HICCUP as he spots the problem. He adjusts his drawing carefully erasing one half of the dragon's tail. He accidentally drops the charcoal stick. It rolls off of th rock outcropping that hides him from view and bounces int the cove. TINK. TINK. TINK. The Night Fury raises his head, spotting Hiccup. They exchange a profound, unflinching stare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A storm is brewing outside. The great doors rattle on the hinges.

dialogues.speaker: GOBBER, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Alright. Where did Astrid go wrong in the ring today? The recruits are seated at a table, eating dinner by the of the fire pit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mistimed my summersault dive. It was sloppy. It threw off my reverse tumble. Eye rolls from the group.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. We noticed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grabbing Astrid's hand) No, no, you were great. That was so 'Astrid'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's right, you have to be tough on yourselves. CREAK. All eyes turn to Hiccup, entering the hall, sheepishly. Gobber glares at him.

dialogues.speaker: GOBBER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (glaring at Hiccup) Where did Hiccup go wrong? He tries to take a seat at the table...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He showed up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't get eaten. ... but the recruits keep closing the gaps. Rolling his e Hiccup sits at the vacant table next to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's never where he should be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Astrid. Gobber stands.

dialogues.speaker: GOBBER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You need to live and breathe this stuff. Gobber lays a giant book in the center of the table.

dialogues.speaker: GOBBER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The dragon manual. Everything we know about every dragon we know of. A RUMBLE of thunder shakes the hall. Rain pours down outs

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No attacks tonight. Study up. Gobber EXITS into the storm, leaving the teens staring at book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (you've got to be kidding) Wait, you mean read?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While we're still alive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why read words when you can just kill the stuff the words tell you stuff about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh! I've read it like, seven times. There's this water dragon that sprays boiling water at your face. And there's this other one that buries itself for like a week... The teens stare as Fishlegs goes on too long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that sounds great. There was a chance I was going to read that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...but now... Snotlout gets up to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys read, I'll go kill stuff. The others follow, with Fishlegs in tow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh and there's this other one that has these spines that look like trees... Astrid is the last to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I guess we'll share--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Read it. She pushes it toward him and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All mine then. Wow, so okay. I'll

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slam.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tomorrow. SIGH.

dialogues.speaker: ON HICCUP'S HAND
dialogues.text: OPENING the massive book. Thunder BOOMS outside. The hall vacant and dark, but for the few candles he's pulled together. Hiccup pours through page after page of strange and frightening dragons.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Dragon classifications. Strike class. Fear class. Mystery class. Hiccup turns the page.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Thunderdrum. This reclusive dragon inhabits sea caves and dark tide pools.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: When startled, the Thunderdrum produces a concussive sound that can kill a man at close range. Extremely dangerous. Kill on sight. Hiccup's eyes drift to a lurid illustration of decapitate Vikings. Another page, another dragon.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Timberjack. This gigantic creature has razor sharp wings that can slice through full grown trees...extremely dangerous. Kill on sight. The illustrations seem to take on a life of their own, shifting and squirming in the candlelight.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Scauldron. Sprays scalding water at its victim. Extremely dangerous. The storm outside rages against the shuttered windows. Hi is startled, but presses on.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Changewing. Even newly hatched dragons can spray acid. Kill on sight. He begins flipping through the pages. A blur of dragons..

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Gronckle. Zippleback. The Skrill. Bone Knapper. Whispering Death. Burns its victims. Buries its victims. Chokes its victims. Turns its victims inside-out. Extremely dangerous. Extremely dangerous. Kill on sight. Kill on sight. Kill on sight... Hiccup finally lands upon the page he's been looking for.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Night Fury. It's BLANK -- no image, save for a few, sparse details.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Speed unknown. Size unknown. The unholy offspring of lightning and death itself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Never engage this dragon. Your only chance, hide and pray it does not find you. Hiccup pulls his sketchbook out of his vest and opens it his drawing of Toothless. He lays it over the book's blan page and considers it. CLOSE ON the drawing of Toothless...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A painted DRAGON, with a sword run through it. It's the billowing sail of Stoick's ship. Stoick hovers over the familiar nautical map -- his eyes the uncharted corner, swirling in mist and illustrations dragons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can almost smell them. They're close. Steady. Stoick raises his gaze to... AN EPIC FOG BANK, towering from sky to sea like a bruised daunting curtain, beyond which nothing is visible. The th ships drift alongside it, skirting its solid edge, lookin for an opening. ON DECK the crewmen mill nervously, all too aware of what Stoick is considering.

dialogues.speaker: STOICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Take us in. The helmsman steers Stoick's ship into the fog. The men d their weapons, prepping for the worst.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hard to port... for Helheim's gate. The first ship disappears into the whiteout, followed by other two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010 Suddenly a flash of light. A silhouette of a dragon. Holl Sounds of splitting and shattering wood. Plunges into the water. Another bright flash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON a DRAGON painted onto a shield. Hiccup runs his finger over its outline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I just happened to notice the book had nothing on Night Furies. Is there another book? Or a sequel? Maybe a little Night Fury pamphlet? KABLAM! A blast takes the axe head off of Hiccup's hilt, leaving a smoking hole behind him. Hiccup YELPS and RUNS.

dialogues.speaker: GOBBER, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: FOCUS Hiccup! You're not even trying. CUT BACK to reveal a Deadly Nadder, loose in a maze-like arrangement of moveable walls. Gobber calls orders from above.

dialogues.speaker: GOBBER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Today... is all about attack. The Nadder hops from wall to wall, sending the recruits scurrying.

dialogues.speaker: GOBBER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Nadders are quick and light on their feet. Your job is to be quicker and lighter. The teens move in, stumbling over Hiccup and his unwieldy shield. The Nadder spots Fishlegs' ample rear hiding behi wall. It whips its tail of spikes. Fishlegs SCREAMS and l an entire wall to shield himself from the spray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm really beginning to question your teaching methods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look for its blind spot. Every dragon has one. Find it, hide in it, and strike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010 Ruff and Tuff rush in, diving and rolling up to the Nadde nose. The Nadder sniffs the air -- it can't see them. Tuf and Ruff are smashed together - too close for comfort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you ever bathe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you don't like it, then just get your own blind spot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about I give you one! Ruff and Tuff SHOVE each other, till their movement and n gives them away. The Nadder ATTACKS, SNAPPING at both of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blind spot? Yes. Deaf spot? Not so much. Hiccup wanders up to Gobber, while the others dart past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, so how would one sneak up on a Night Fury?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None one's ever met one and lived to tell the tale. Now get in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, I know, but hypothetically...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hiccup! She puts her finger to her lips and gestures for him to h A moment later, the Nadder leaps over the walls, surprisi them by landing in front of her. Astrid somersaults into its blind spot, confusing it. She rears back to strike -- just as Snotlout LEAPS IN, protectively SWEEPING Astrid behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch out babe. I'll take care of this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Snotlout MISSES. Astrid glares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun was in my eyes, Astrid. What do you want me to do, block out the sun? I could do that, but I don't have time right now! The Nadder tears off after her, knocking down walls in pursuit. She leaps and dives like a highly trained gymnas Hiccup wanders up to Gobber again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They probably take the daytime off. You know, like a cat. Has anyone ever seen one napping?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hiccup!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Hiccup! Hiccup spins around to see the maze walls collapsing like dominos toward him. Astrid comes flying through the dust crash-lands on top of him, laying him out in a limb-tangl mess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oooh! Love on the battlefield!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She could do better. The Nadder closes in, emerging through the cloud of dust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (struggling to untangle) Just... let me... why don't you... The Nadder spins around and races back toward them like a Raptor. Astrid untangles herself and tries to pull her axe from Hiccup's shield... which is attached to his limp, gangly She PLANTS her foot on his torso and YANKS the axe free, still burrowed into the shield.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010 She SPINS and SWINGS the axe and shield, scoring a DIRECT on the oncoming Nadder's NOSE. It yelps and scurries off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well done, Astrid. Gobber hobbles off to wrestle the Nadder back into his ca Hiccup gets to his feet -- all eyes are upon him. He turn find Astrid glaring at him, winded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this some kind of a joke to you? Our parents' war is about to become ours. Figure out which side you're on. She grabs her axe and stomps off. Hiccup watches, stung.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fish... being thrown into the cove. It hits the ground slides. A moment later, Hiccup peeks through a gap in the rock, looking around cautiously. Nothing. Hiccup squeezes through and enters the cove. A BEAT, then Hiccup hears a SNORT from behind him. Hiccup turns to see the Night Fury, crouched on a rock li stealthy panther. It descends, approaching him... ready t pounce. Hiccup swallows his fear and offers the fish. Doing so reveals the dagger at his waist. The dragon sees it and hisses. Hiccup reaches for it, eliciting a growl. He paus carefully lifts it by the handle, and tosses it away. The dragon calms. As it approaches the fish, Hiccup notices that it's missi teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh. Toothless. I could've sworn you had... A set of razor sharp teeth emerge from its gums to grab t fish. Toothless snatches and gnashes it up, swallowing it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ... teeth. The teeth retract again. Toothless presses closer with an expectant look. Hiccup retreats nervously.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Uh, no. No, I don't have any more. The Fury backs Hiccup against a rock, placing himself the same position as before. The dragon closes in over him, staring blankly. A tense moment passes... then Toothless regurgitates a ch of fish onto Hiccup's lap. They exchange stares. Hiccup realizes what Toothless wants him to do. Hiccup crouches slowly and squeamishly picks it up. The dragon waits expectantly. Hiccup gags and gnaws off a bite of the slimy fish. He forces a smile. Toothless mimi him. Amazed, Hiccup sits up and tries to touch him. Toothless HISSES and flaps off to a crash on the other side of the cove. He BLASTS the mossy ground to a red-hot temperature and curls up on it like a giant dog. He turns to find Hiccup seated beside him. Toothless tolerates his persistent presence... until Hiccup tries t touch his damaged tail. Toothless SNAPS at him. Hiccup ta the hint and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's MAGIC HOUR. Toothless wakes, hanging upside down fro tree. He spots Hiccup sitting on the other side of the co Sketching in the sand. CLOSE ON a sketch of Toothless. Hiccup draws with a stick minding his own business. Toothless appears behind him, watching carefully. Aware of his presence, Hiccup continu trying not to scare him off. Toothless walks off. A moment later, he reappears with an entire sapling, drawing lines in the sand. He rushes here there, making haphazard lines in every direction. Finally, Toothless drops the tree and inspects his work. seems pleased.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010 Hiccup stands and takes in the sprawling scribble, amazed it. He accidentally steps onto one of the lines, elicitin instant growl from Toothless. He steps on it again. Tooth growls again. Realizing how sensitive he is, Hiccup steps carefully between each line, turning round and round unti unwittingly bumps into Toothless. Toothless snorts. Once again, they're face to face. Hiccu slowly extends his hand. Toothless hesitates. Hiccup turn his head away and closes his eyes. To his amazement, Toothless bridges the gap and presses his muzzle against Hiccup's hand. In a flash, the dragon is gone, leaving Hiccup astounded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gobber and the recruits are seated at the top of an aband catapult tower, toasting campfire food around a roaring bonfire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and with one twist he took my hand and swallowed it whole. And I saw the look on his face. (can't deny it) I was delicious. He must have passed the word, because it wasn't a month before another one of them took my leg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't it weird to think that your hand was inside a dragon. Like if your mind was still in control of it you could have killed the dragon from the inside by crushing his heart or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I swear I'm so angry right now. I'll avenge your beautiful hand and your beautiful foot. I'll chop off the legs of every dragon I fight, with my face. He postures to Astrid. She rolls her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a mouthful) Un-unh. It's the wings and the tails you really want. If it can't fly, it can't get away. A downed dragon is a dead dragon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010 ON HICCUP hiding his horrified look form the others. Gobber stands and stretches.

dialogues.speaker: GOBBER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Alright. I'm off to bed. You should be too. Tomorrow we get into the big boys. Slowly but surely making our way up to the Monstrous Nightmare. (playful, taunting) But who'll win the honor of killing it? He hobbles off. The teens reflect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very matter of fact) It's gonna be me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's my destiny. See? Tuffnut rolls up his sleeve to reveal a red dragon on his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your mom let you get a tattoo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not a tattoo. It's a birthmark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I've been stuck with you since birth, and that was never there before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes it was. You've just never seen me from the left side until now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't there yesterday. Is it a birthmark or a today-mark? Hiccup gets up and walks away from the group. Astrid watc him as he leaves the bonfire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hiccup enters a small room at the back of the stall. It's covered in drawings of weaponry and scale models. He ligh candle and lays his sketchbook out on the desk, opening i the drawing of Toothless. With a look of determination. Hiccup picks up a charcoal stick and re-draws the missing tail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... a creaking leather bellows. The stone forge glows wit every pump. Tongs pull intricate iron pieces from the coa They're dropped onto the anvil, twisted, lightly hammered and dunked in a barrel. The pieces are carried to Hiccup's workbench and laid out place on a one-to-one schematic. It's a sketch of a mechanical fin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hiccup arrives, winded, straining under the weight of a f basket. He clicks the scale he found (like a jar top). Toothless approaches, sniffing him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Toothless. I brought breakfast. I hope you're hungry. Hiccup drops the basket and kicks it over. Fish spill out

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay, that's disgusting. Toothless approaches, settling in to devour the feast.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Uh..we've got some salmon... Toothless swallows it.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ... some nice Icelandic cod... Swallows those too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ... and a whole smoked eel. Toothless nabs it, chews a few times, then spits it out. shakes his head violently, snorts and scrubs his massive tongue on the sand. Hiccup takes note.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No, no, no! It's okay. Yeah, I don't like eel much either. Toothless focuses on the remainder. With the dragon distracted, Hiccup unwraps his prosthetic fin and opens i like a fan.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay. That's it. That's it, just stick with good stuff. And don't you mind me. I'll just be back...here. Minding my own business. Hiccup cautiously approaches the injured tail, but every he gets near it, Toothless sweeps it away like a cat.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's okay. Hiccup drops a knee on top of the tail. Toothless' head j up, slows its chewing to a halt.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay...okay.. The dragon tenses, slowly spreading his wings. Hiccup str the prosthetic fin in place. He cinches the straps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There. Not too bad. It works. Toothless BOLTS! He snaps his massive wings and takes to air, carrying Hiccup with him.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Woah! No! No! No! Hiccup struggles to hold on to the tail. As the ground sp away, Toothless immediately TIPS into a uncontrolled bank dive. Hiccup sees the folded fin rattling uselessly in oppositi to its flared counterpart. Flap as he may, Toothless can' correct his trajectory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010 Hiccup swallows his fear and crawls toward the folded prosthetic. He reaches it and YANKS it open. The flared, like appendage catches the air, stabilizing the twisting tail.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (excited, terrified) It's working! Toothless arcs just short of the water and climbs... high into the air.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Yes! Yes, I did it. He glances back at Hiccup, busily holding the tail open w trying to hold on. They're going to crash. Whoomp! Hiccup is suddenly thrown from the tail in the intense force of a turn.

dialogues.speaker: AAAAAGGGGHHHHH
dialogues.text: He bounces across the water's surface and takes a dive. Without Hiccup to operate the tail, Toothless does the sa plunging in a massive cannonball. Hiccup resurfaces, roughed up, but beaming. Toothless app seconds later.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Yeah!

dialogues.speaker: GOBBER, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Today is about teamwork. Work together and you might survive. ON A DOUBLE-WIDE DOOR. Gas seeps through the cracks. It BLASTS OPEN. A cloud of smoke engulfs the ring, swirli around the paired-up teens. Astrid with Ruffnut. Snotlout with Tuffnut. Fishlegs with Hiccup. All carry buckets of water, poised to throw them.

dialogues.speaker: GOBBER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now, a wet dragon head can't light its fire. The Hideous Zippleback is extra tricky. One head breathes gas, the other head lights it. Your job is to know which is which.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010 The smoke encircles them, cutting them off from each othe The teens LISTEN and WATCH for any sign of the dragon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (muttering to himself) Razor sharp, serrated teeth that inject venom for pre-digestion. Prefers ambush attack, crushing its victims in its...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you please stop that?

dialogues.speaker: ON SNOTLOUT AND TUFFNUT
dialogues.text: Moving nervously through the fog, back to back. Snotlout singing to himself to calm his nerves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If that dragon shows either of his faces, I'm gonna-- (spotting an approaching shape, terrified) --There! Snotlout and Tuffnut HURL their water into the fog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's us, idiots. Astrid and Ruffnut are soaked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your butts are getting bigger. We thought you were a dragon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not that there's anything wrong with a dragon-esque figure. Astrid ELBOWS Snotlout in the face. Ruffnut DROPS Tuffnut with a PUNCH to the throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. They FREEZE. A tail SWEEPS out of the fog, taking them do Their buckets spill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010 ON FISHLEGS AND HICCUP coming across them. They see the puddles of spilled water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm hurt. I am very much hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chances of survival are dwindling into single digits now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look out! A Zippleback head emerges out of the smoke. Fishlegs hurl his water at it, completely dousing the head. It leers an opens its mouth, spewing gas into the area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Wrong head. GAS FLOWS around their legs. Fishlegs flees in a panic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fishlegs! Beat. A clicking sound comes from behind them. Sparks fla in the smoke.

dialogues.speaker: GOBBER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now, Hiccup! The other head sweeps out of the smoke. Hiccup hurls his water with all his might. It arcs and drops short of the dragon's sparking mouth. The dragon grins, savoring the k

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, come on!

dialogues.speaker: RUN, HICCUP
dialogues.text: Gobber COVERS his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: GOBBER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hiccup! Beat. The Zippleback hesitates. SNIFFS. Then retreats. The teens get to their feet, watching transfixed. Gobber peeks through his fingers to see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010 The Zippleback backing away from Hiccup. He stands and ho his hands out, as if controlling it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BACK! BACK! BACK! Now don't you make me tell you again! The Zippleback retreats through its door and into its cav hissing.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Yes, that's right. Back into your cage. Hiccup slyly OPENS his vest, revealing the spotted smoked from earlier. He TOSSES it inside the door, then SLAMS it shut.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now think about what you've done. Hiccup turns to the teens and Gobber. They stare, slack-j

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay! So are we done? Because I've got some things I need to... Hiccup jogs out of the ring, past the speechless group.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Yep...see you tomorrow. Astrid SNEERS. Something's going on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hiccup cuts and stitches leather, draws and shapes steel. works by candlelight. An overhead shot reveals what he's building: a harness, complete with handles and foot pedal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hiccup appears before Toothless, holding the new prosthet Toothless runs off as Hiccup chases him down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toothless and Hiccup are zooming over the ocean. The tail breaks free sending Hiccup flying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah! Whoa!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hiccup adjusts the harness and uses a metal clamp to affi himself to Toothless' saddle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hiccup and Toothless zip through the air -- his rudimenta harness and tail controls are working, barely. They crash land in an open field. Hiccup recovers to find Toothless still rolling around in tall grass. Hiccup discovers that it's a patch of drag nip.' Toothless writhes on his back, tongue wagging, in complete bliss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hiccup grabs the head as instructed, then discreetly pull fistful of dragon-nip' and presses it up to the Gronkl nose. It immediately stops struggling and goes weak in th knees. Hiccup drops the handful of dragon-nip to the grou The Gronkle goes down with it, whimpering and blissful. From Gobber and the recruits' point of view, Hiccup is controlling the Gronkle with no more than a limp arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The recruits walk home together, surrounding Hiccup and BOMBARDING HIM WITH QUESTIONS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Hiccup, I've never seen a Gronkle to that before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was really cool. He squirms and invents an excuse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I left my axe back in the ring. He turns and hurries back.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You guys go on ahead and I'll catch up with you. Astrid watches, suspicious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hiccup rubs Toothless behind the ear, causing him to rela and fall over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An angry Deadly Nadder approaches Hiccup. Just as Astrid moves in to strike, Hiccup performs his special rubbing technique, which sends the Nadder down. Astrid and the ot kids look on from the sideline in amazement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hiccup sits down at a table to eat. The other recruits no him and move over to his table to talk to him -- leaving Astrid alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Hiccup!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that? Some kind of trick? What did you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hiccup, you're totally going to come in first, there's no question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hiccup is using a mirror-like object to create a patch of light on the ground. Toothless claws and chases the light patch like a cat chasing a laser pointer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beam lifts from the door of another dragon pen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meet the Terrible Terror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010 A tiny, pint-sized dragon steps out and moves toward the recruits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha. It's like the size of my-- Tuffnut is taken down in a blur.

dialogues.speaker: TUFFNUT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Get it off! Get it off! Oh! I'm hurt, I am very much hurt! Hiccup stops the Terrible Terror with the same light-patc trick he used earlier with Toothless. The tiny dragon retreats back to it's cage. The teens approach him yet ag as Astrid looks on with suspicion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow, he's better than you ever were.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Astrid furiously hurls her axe at a nearby tree. She noti Hiccup walking by in the distance, carrying one of his trademark harnesses. She quickly tries to follow, but he loses her in the woods. She HUFFS, frustrated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hiccup straps a newly designed harness onto Toothless. Wi Toothless tied to a nearby post with a rope. Hiccup rides in the air -- while stationary. Toothless looks like a gi kite tied to a tree stump. This harness seems to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rope breaks and the pair CRASH into a tree. Hiccup's is red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The streets are empty save for a lone Viking who crosses Hiccup's path.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hiccup. Hiccup nods, trying to look casual. Once the coast is cle he covertly steers Toothless into the Blacksmith's stall. Toothless PRESSES himself inside, rooting through stuff a making a racket. Astrid, walking nearby, is alerted.

dialogues.speaker: ASTRID, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Hiccup? Hiccup FREEZES. Then frantically tries to pry the ring of the saddle hook. It won't budge.

dialogues.speaker: ASTRID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Are you in there? Too late - she's right outside. ON ASTRID walking along the outside of the Blacksmith's. Hiccup JUMPS OUT the window and CLOSES the shutters behin him. Hiccup's harness line is stretched through the windo still attached to Toothless' saddle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Astrid. Hey! Hi Astrid. Hi Astrid. Hi Astrid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I normally don't care what people do, but you're acting weird. Well, weirder. Toothless spots a nearby sheep and makes a move toward it a result, Hiccup is suddenly PULLED TIGHT against the win shutters. He STRIKES A POSE to compensate... then gets PU THROUGH the shutters. They snap back in Astrid's face. Astrid reopens them and finds nothing but an empty stall. In the distance, Toothless and Hiccup slip off unseen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lone, battered ship is pulled into a slip, overloaded w equally battered-looking men. They disembark to a crowd o onlookers, looking like a team of hometown heroes who jus had their butts kicked. Gobber hobbles through the MUMBLING crowd to find Stoick last to disembark and glowering with battered pride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are the other ships?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't want to know. Stoick lumbers past Gobber, leaving him staring at the trashed ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I trust you found the nest at least?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not even close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah. Excellent. Gobber follows Stoick up the ramp and snags his duffle ba with his hook appendage, sharing the burden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope you had a little more success than me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if by success, you mean that your parenting troubles are over with, then... yes. Stoick stops. What does that mean? A group of merry villagers rush past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations Stoick! Everyone is so relieved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out with the old and in with the new, right?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one will miss that old nuisance!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The village is throwing a party to celebrate! Stoick is stunned, overwhelmed by the insensitivity. He t to Gobber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's... gone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...most afternoons. But who can blame him? I mean the life of a celebrity is very rough. He can barely walk through the village without being swarmed by his new fans. Stoick is doubly confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hiccup?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who would've thought, eh? He has this...way with the beasts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toothless and Hiccup soar through a perfect blue sky. Billowing clouds rise like mountains. The ground seems mi below them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay there bud, we're gonna take this nice and slow. Hiccup checks a leather cheat sheet, clipped onto his harness. Inscribed upon it are several tail positions and their pedal position equivalents.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Here we go. Here we go...position three, no four. He presses the pedal, causing the tail to flare. They rol off into an arcing bank, gloriously lit by the late after sun. Hiccup tucks tight against his neck, thrilled that his ne harness and vest are holding. The foot controls make the appendage quick and responsive. He watches Toothless' eve fluctuation, trying to match it with the prosthetic. Hiccup sizes up a target -- a towering arch of stone, ris from the sea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Alright, it's go time. It's go time. They dive toward it, lining up to pass through the arch.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come on. Come on buddy. Come on buddy! They zip through the arch. A perfect maneuver.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Yeah! Yes, it worked! The triumph is short-lived. They smack into one of severa sea stacks as Hiccup tries to keep up with the turns.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sorry. They hurtle into another rock pillar. Toothless grumbles.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: My fault. Toothless swats him with his 'ear' plate.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah, I'm on it. (referring to the cheat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Position four, no three. They pierce the clouds. For the first time, Hiccup can se the whole of the island below them. It shrinks with every passing second. He SWALLOWS hard and tightens his grip on handles.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
