dialogues.text: Yeah! Go baby! Yes! Oh, this is amazing! The wind in my... He spots the leather guide tearing free in the turbulence

dialogues.speaker: ... CHEAT SHEET
dialogues.text: Hiccup grabs frantically for the airborne sheet...

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010 ... and NABS IT before it's carried out of reach. Toothle however, obeys the command and suddenly STOPS beating his wings. As they slow to a stop, Hiccup goes weightless. The rings his vest float off of the harness hooks. Hiccup suddenly finds himself detached, free-falling.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh gods! Oh no! Without Hiccup, the tail loses control. Hiccup and Toothl spiral downward. Toothless FIGHTS to get back under Hiccu

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (trying to calm Toothless) Alright, okay. You just gotta kinda angle yourself. No, no...come back down towards me. Come back down-- Hiccup extends his arms and legs, giving himself as much surface area as he can. He angles back towards Toothless the tumbling dragon WHACKS Hiccup with his wing. After a few more misses, Hiccup finally GRABS HOLD of the harness and manages to lock in -- just in time to pull Toothless out of his dive... barely shy of the tree tops. They careen past the wooded cliff and directly into a treacherous slalom course of jutting sea stacks. Hiccup pulls the cheat sheet from his teeth and attempts check positions. It flaps violently in the turbulence, ma it impossible. With no time to think, Hiccup throws it away and steers Toothless' tail on instinct... with perfect intuition. Together, they manage a tight, hair-rasing series of spli second turns, making it to the open water, unscathed. Hiccup takes a breath and glances back at the death-defyi obstacle course, now safely behind them. He beams, reliev He sits back and throws his arms up in victory.

dialogues.speaker: YEEAHHH
dialogues.text: Toothless concurs with a happy SQUEAL and a fireball. Hiccup's glee turn to dread as they fly directly into it.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ah, come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hiccup and Toothless lounge on a sprawling, deserted beac snacking of freshly caught fish. As Hiccup cooks his over fire, Toothless suddenly regurgitates a fish head. Hiccup smirks with forced politeness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh..no thanks. (gesturing to his fish on

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm good. Several Terrible Terrors land like seagulls, hissing and nipping at each other as they approach Toothless' pile of fish. One grabs the regurgitated fish head and drags it away. Another attempts to steal it from him. They face off and fire balls at each other to settle the fight. Hiccup and Toothless watch, amused. That is until... Toothless spots one of his fish leaving the pile. A steal Terrible Terror is exposed as the thief. They tug on the fish, and it snaps back into Toothless' mouth. He swallow back tauntingly. Irate, the little dragon paws at the ground and blast Toothless. He opens his mouth, the gas hiss comes, and Toothless fires a tiny flame straight into its mouth, cau the gas to backfire into the little dragon. It coughs up smoke and staggers away, looking ill. Hiccup laughs.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Not so fireproof on the inside, are you? Hiccup throws the hapless Terror his freshly cooked fish.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Here you go. The appreciative little dragon gulps down the meal and approaches Hiccup cautiously. He curls up next to him. Hi is amazed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything we know about you guys is wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010 Hiccup carefully pets him... sending the Terror into an immediate, blissful sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HICCUP is lost in thought, his head laid of a desk full o Toothless drawings. Burdened with the weight of the world Suddenly, STOICK appears in the doorway. Hiccup jumps and quickly covers up his desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad! You're back! He skirts the bench, blocking Stoick's view of Toothless, prosthetic fin, and other drawings.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Gobber's not here, so... He strikes an awkwardly casual pose, trying to cover up a much as possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. I came looking for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been keeping secrets. Hiccup's legs give out. He slides, dragging the table's contents with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I...have?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just how long did you think you could hide it from me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what you're...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing happens on this island without me hearing about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's talk about that dragon. Blood drains from Hiccup's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh gods. Dad I'm so sorry. I was going to tell you. I just didn't know how to-- Stoick starts laughing. Big, booming. Hiccup stares, baff

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're not...upset?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?! I was hoping for this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh...you were?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And believe me, it only gets better! Just wait til you spill a Nadder's guts for the first time. Hiccup's elated expression sinks.

dialogues.speaker: STOICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And mount your first Gronckle head on a spear. What a feeling! Stoick laughs and smacks Hiccup on the shoulder, sending into the wall.

dialogues.speaker: STOICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You really had me going there, son. All those years of the worst Viking Berk has ever seen! Odin, it was rough. I almost gave up on you! Hiccup gets back up, grimacing in the irony of it all.

dialogues.speaker: STOICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And all the while, you were holding out on me! Thor almighty! Stoick grabs a stool and sits. His massive frame nearly f the tiny room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhhhh. With you doing so well in the ring, we finally have something to talk about. Pregnant pause. Hiccup averts his eyes nervously. Stoick adjusts, awkwardly clearing his throat. After a long, uncomfortable silence...

dialogues.speaker: STOICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh, I... brought you something. He presents a horned helmet.

dialogues.speaker: STOICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: To keep you safe in the ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. Thanks. Hiccup accepts it, looking it over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your mother would've wanted you to have it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's half of her breast plate. Stoick taps his own helmet and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: STOICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Matching set. Keeps her close, y'know? Hiccup eyes the mismatched helmets, grimacing.

dialogues.speaker: STOICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wear it proudly. You deserve it. You've held up your end of the deal. Stoick beams with pride. Hiccup squirms. He forces a YAWN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should really get to bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (talking over each (talking over each

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes! Good! Okay. Good talk. See you back at the house. We should do this again. I'm Great. Thanks for stopping glad I stopped by, I hope you by. And for the... the uh, like the hat. breast hat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well..uh..good night. Stoick leaves the room awkwardly, leaving Hiccup looking burdened than ever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Gronckle hovers above the ring, hunting victims as the recruits scramble. Astrid ducks behind a barrier to find Hiccup already ther She forces her axe at his throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay out of my way! I'm winning this thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, by all means. She darts off, CLOSING FAST on the dragon. The crowd abov cheers her on.

dialogues.speaker: VIKING IN CROWD
dialogues.text: You got it Astrid! Hiccup stands and looks around. Amidst the crowd of onlookers, Stoick watches keenly, beaming with pride. He locks eyes with Hiccup, giving him a nod of encouragem Hiccup adjusts his new helmet and forces a half-hearted smile. Unbeknownst to Hiccup, the Gronckle spots him and makes a line toward him.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO ASTRID
dialogues.text: ... as she catches her breath behind a barrier. She scowl focused, determined.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This time. This time for sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010 With a FIERCE BATTLE-CRY she LEAPS from cover, axe cocked throw.

dialogues.speaker: ASTRID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Aaaaaaaaaa... And as she clears the barriers, she sees that Hiccup has already laid the Gronckle out.

dialogues.speaker: ASTRID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ...aaaaaaauGGGGGHHHHHHHH! No! No! Hiccup shrugs, as unhappy with the situation as she is.

dialogues.speaker: MUNGE BUCKET
dialogues.text: A loud CLACK ring out. From the crowd above, Gothi, the village elder, steps forward, tapping her staff. Everyone lights up excitedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait! Wait!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, later. Gobber snags Hiccup as he attempts to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not so fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm kinda late for--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Late for what exactly? Stoick holds out his hands to silence the jabbering crowd

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay quiet down. The elder has decided. Thrilled, Gobber stands behind Hiccup and Astrid. He poin to Astrid as the crowd waits in silent anticipation. Goth shakes her head 'no.' The crowd 'Oooohs.' Gobber then points to Hiccup. The elder nods an affirmati 'yes.' The crowd erupts in cheers. Astrid turns a seething, deadly glare on Hiccup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've done it! You've done it, Hiccup! You get to kill the dragon!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha, ha! That's my boy! Hiccup is hoisted onto the recruits' shoulders and carrie out to the cheering spectators...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heh, heh. Oh yeah! Yes! I can't wait. I am so...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... leaving. We're leaving. Let's pack up. Looks like you and me are taking a little vacation, forever. Toothless is nowhere in sight. Hiccup sets down his baske and opens it up, his head clouded with troubles.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh..man... SHINK! Hiccup looks up to the sound of... ASTRID, sitting on the rock right in front of him, sharpe her axe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aggh! What the--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here? She hops off the rock and back him down, spinning her axe threateningly. Hiccup's eyes dart around nervously, searc for Toothless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to know what's going on. No one just gets as good as you do. Especially you. Start talking! Are you training with someone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh...training? She grabs him by his odd-looking harness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It better not involve... this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know this looks really bad, but you see...this is, uh... They hear a RUSTLE coming from the other side of the cove Astrid DROPS Hiccup to the ground and sets off to investigate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right! You're right. I'm through with the lies. I've been making... outfits. So you got me. It's time everyone knew. Drag me back. Go ahead. Here we go. He puts her hand back on his harness, getting her to 'dra him back.' Astrid BENDS Hiccups hand backwards, driving h down.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: AAAAUUGGGHHH! Why would you do that?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's for the lies. Astrid pounces the hilt of her axe off of Hiccup's laid-o body.

dialogues.speaker: ASTRID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And THAT'S for everything else. Hiccup's YELP is answered with A GROWL, coming from the o side of the cove. Astrid looks up to see... A NIGHT FURY. Toothless pounces toward them, snarling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh man. She dives onto Hiccup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get down! Run! Run! Astrid pulls her axe, ready to take on Toothless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010 Hiccup knocks Astrid's cocked axe to the ground, out of reach, then stops Toothless short of crushing her.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No. It's okay! It's okay... Toothless pulls up short and lands hard, SPRAYING Astrid sand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's a friend. Toothless snorts in disagreement. Astrid is frozen. Tooth looks from her to Hiccup and back to her, confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just scared him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I scared him!? Hiccup makes a be quiet motion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is him? HICCUP. Astrid, Toothless. Toothless, Astrid. Astrid backs away, eyeing Hiccup and Toothless together w pure disgust. She turns and RUNS for the village.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're dead. Satisfied with Astrid's departure, Toothless turns away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where do you think you're going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ASTRID races through the trees. A large shadow overtakes She is suddenly SNATCHED into the air. Astrid SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh great Odin's ghost, this is it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010 Hiccup and Toothless fly Astrid to the top of a towering pine. It bows and creaks under their weight as Astrid dan a hundred feet in the air.

dialogues.speaker: ASTRID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hiccup! Get me down from here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to give me a chance to explain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not listening to ANYTHING you have to say!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I won't speak. Just let me show you. Hiccup extends a hand.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Please, Astrid. She eyes him and the dragon, then the ground far, far bel After a moment, she swats Hiccup's outstretched hand away reluctantly climbs over the pedal, lines, and harness. Sh settles behind Hiccup, avoiding as much contact as possib

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now get me down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toothless? Down. Gently. Toothless leers mischievously. He spreads his wings slowl With a WHOP, they fill with the updraft. Toothless releas the tree, tucks in his legs, and HOVERS in place.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: See? Nothing to be afraid of. Toothless suddenly LAUNCHES straight upward. Astrid SCREA The acceleration is tremendous. Every downbeat bucks the saddle, heaving them into the sky, doubling their speed l a rocket. Astrid is thrown backward. She SCREAMS and hugs Hiccup for dear life, squeezing the breath out of him.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Toothless! What is wrong with you?! Bad dragon! (mortified; to Astrid) He's not usually like this. Oh no...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010 Toothless ROLLS and PLUMMETS toward the coastline far bel Astrid SCREAMS. Toothless rockets over the ocean waves, deliberately dipp them in the froth.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Toothless, what are you doing?! We need her to like us! Toothless rockets skyward and begins tumbling head over t

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And now the spinning. Thank you for nothing you useless reptile. Astrid clamps her hand over her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay! I'm sorry! I'm sorry! Just get me off of this thing. Astrid is defeated, her aggressive energy gone. Satisfied Toothless relents. They level off and head up into the clouds. Astrid opens eyes again, and looks out over a world she'd never dreame of. She reaches out and touches clouds, pierces columns ablaze in golden hues, and floats over a vast, alien sky- scape. Her terror is replaced by wonder. She grins, despi herself. Toothless rises above a blanket of clouds...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and levels off under a starry sky. They emerge from a blanket of clouds under the dancing Northern Lights, shimmering in ribbons across the vast sky. Below them, Berk's torches flicker in the inky darkness. new perspective is breathtaking. Astrid tucks her arms into Hiccup's vest, burying her chi into his shoulder. The moment is not lost on either of th Hiccup smiles nervously. Toothless climbs past Berk's tallest peaks and heads out open water, leaving the village lights behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright I admit it. This is pretty cool. It's... amazing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's amazing. Astrid carefully reaches down and pats Toothless' side.

dialogues.speaker: ASTRID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So what now? Hiccup groans. It's a problem without an answer.

dialogues.speaker: ASTRID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hiccup, your final exam is tomorrow. You know you're going to have to kill...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... kill a dragon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't remind me. A strange, unearthly din approaches. Toothless' ear plate suddenly stand on end. Panicked, he abruptly dives, dippi into cloud cover.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Toothless! What's happening? What is it? Toothless BARKS at him. 'Quiet!' Suddenly, out of the dense cloud, a Monstrous Nightmare emerges.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Get down! Hiccup and Astrid duck. The Nightmare calls out. A Zipple appears to the other side of Toothless, boxing him in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toothless. You've got to get us out of here, bud. Toothless HISSES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010 Other dragons, previously invisible in the thick clouds, appear all around them. HUNDREDS of them, all carrying fi and game in their talons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It looks like they're hauling in their kill. The Zippleback eyes them ravenously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that make us? The dragons BANK and dive in formation, plummeting throug the thickening fog and weaving between towering, craggy s stacks. They emerge at the base of a massive volcanic caldera, glowing with rivulets of lava. The flock of dragons fall rank, funneling through a crack, and zipping through a winding tunnel. It gives way to a vast, steamy inner chamber, tiered with pocky shelves. Dragons of all breeds lay about, nested in hordes. The arriving dragons fly in, dropping the fish and game i a central pit, glowing red and shrouded in mist. Hiccup is amazed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What my dad wouldn't give to find this. Toothless peels away from the procession, landing on a sm shadowy shelf to keep a low-profile. Hiccup and Astrid peek around, taking in the busy hive of sorts. They watch as the food continues to be dropped int the pit.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's satisfying to know that all of our food has been dumped down a hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're not eating any of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010 Last to arrive is a dim-witted Gronckle. It hovers over t pit and regurgitates his paltry contribution -- a patheti little fish. As it falls into the steamy pit, a terrible rings out. The Gronckle tries to flee, but before it can, a gargantu dragon head juts from the steamy pit and SNAPS it out of air. Swallowing it back whole. Hiccup and Astrid recoil, terrified.

dialogues.speaker: ASTRID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What is that? The monstrous beast SNIFFS the air, seemingly aware of th It nears the ledge where Toothless is hiding... and ROARS Several dragons take flight in fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright buddy, we gotta get out of here. Now! Toothless takes flight, barely evading the monster's snap jaws. The behemoth dragon lunges for them, snatching a Zippleba out of the air instead. Toothless disappears into the winged exodus as thousands dragons flee the caldera in fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toothless glides into the cove and touches down on the moonlit beach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (her mind reeling, talking Hiccup's ear off) No, no, it totally makes sense. It's like a giant beehive. They're the workers... and that's their queen. It controls them. She leaps off of Toothless and runs toward the village.

dialogues.speaker: ASTRID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let's find your dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no! Not yet. They'll... kill Toothless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Astrid, we have to think this through carefully. Astrid eyes him, incredulous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hiccup, we just discovered the dragons' nest...the thing we've been after since Vikings first sailed here. And you want to keep it a secret? To protect your pet dragon? Are you serious? Hiccup stands firm, resolute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Astrid's taken aback.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what do we do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just give me until tomorrow. I'll figure something out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Astrid PUNCHES Hiccup in the arm.

dialogues.speaker: ASTRID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That's for kidnapping me. Hiccup looks to Toothless for support. Toothless SNORTS, dismissive. Astrid grabs him. He braces for another hit. She KISSES Hiccup on the cheek.

dialogues.speaker: ASTRID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That's for, everything else. In the awkward wake of the moment, Astrid hurries off... leaving Hiccup RUBBING his cheek, stunned. Toothless hobbles up, eyeing him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you looking at?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The grounds have been transformed. Banners and flags flap the morning sun. Surrounding the ring, a festive crowd ha gathered. All of Berk has turned out for the event.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (aloud to the crowd) Well, I can show my face in public again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If someone had told me that in a few short weeks, Hiccup would go from being, well... Hiccup, to placing first in dragon training... I would've tied him to a mast and shipped him off for fear he'd gone mad. Yes! And you know it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But here we are. And no one's more surprised... ON HICCUP standing at the entrance to the ring, listening looking burdened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... or more proud than I am. Today, my boy becomes a Viking. TODAY, HE

dialogues.speaker: BECOMES ONE OF US
dialogues.text: CHEERS and ROARS. Astrid approaches Hiccup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be careful with that dragon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: the roaring crowd) It's not the dragon I'm worried about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put an end to this. She eyes him, dubious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I have to try.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Astrid. If something goes wrong... just make sure they don't find Toothless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will. Just promise me it won't go wrong. Hiccup can't. Gobber approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's time, Hiccup. Knock him dead. Hiccup puts his helmet on and enters the ring.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE TEENS
dialogues.text: HOOTING and HOLLERING from the stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show 'em how it's done, my man! Hiccup locks eyes with Stoick. Stoick nods with a smile. Hiccup returns a half-smile. Takes a deep breath. He hoists a shield onto his forearm and selects his weapo from a rack of many -- a small dagger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hrmph. I would've gone for the hammer. Hiccup turns to face a bolted, heavy door. Takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm ready. The door bolt is raised. The crowd grows quiet... Beat. BOOM! The doors blast open with a stream of sticky fire. Followed by a Monstrous Nightmare, coated in flames. It t out of its cave like an irate bull -- as the crowd roars jeers. It climbs the walls and chain enclosure like a bat, hissi at the provoking crowd and blasting fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010 It spots Hiccup and descends, leering and licking the fla drool from its lips. The crowd grows silent, bracing for the big fight. With the Monstrous Nightmare's eyes locked upon him, Hicc deliberately drops his shield and dagger stepping away fr them. The dragon pauses, confused. ON STOICK, also confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is he doing? The dragon presses closer, snorting. Hiccup extends his o hand. It snarls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. It's okay. The dragon continues to pace, focused on... HICCUP'S HELM Hiccup realizes, then reaches up and removes it. Taking a breath to acknowledge the point of no return, he tosses t helmet aside. It hits the ground.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm not one of them. GASPS and MURMURS race through the crowd. ON STOICK, as all eyes turn to him. He's welling with ups Hiccup avoids Stoick's glare and remains focused on the Nightmare, holding his hand out. It paces around him, cal down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop the fight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I need you all to see this. The crowd gets restless.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They're not what we think they are. We don't have to kill them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010 Stoick whacks his hammer against the iron enclosure, ratt the arena with a terrible reverberating clatter. Spooked, the Nightmare snaps at Hiccup's outstretched han Hiccup YELPS and springs backward. The spell is broken. The Nightmare reacts to Hiccup's sud movements and blasts another stream of fire. Hiccup SCREA and barely dives out of reach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His ear plates shoot up. Panic flares in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hiccup scrambles around the ring. The Nightmare pursues, snapping and springing from ground to wall. Stoick pushes through the crowd, rushing to the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of my way!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hiccup! Astrid wedges her axe under the arena gate and squeezes through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toothless bounds to the cove walls, clawing them in desperation. It seems he's as trapped as before, but with incredible BURST of effort he HOOKS a claw over the upper of the stone wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A narrow stream of fire narrowly avoids Hiccup as he continues to dash around the ring, evading the Monstrous Nightmare. Desperate, he goes to the weapon rack in an attempt to arm himself, but the Nightmare quickly destroy the rack and closes in on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toothless tears through the woods, bounding like panther taking to the air in short bursts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stoick wrenches the grated door to the arena and jumps through. The Monstrous Nightmare is only a few feet behin Hiccup. Astrid is now in the ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hiccup! She picks up a hammer and hurls it at the Monstrous Nightmare, hitting it in the head. It turns its attention Astrid, and begins chasing her. Stoick raises the arena g waving her toward it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This way! Astrid makes it through, but the Nightmare BLASTS the doorway, cutting Hiccup off. It pounces on him and prepar to finish him off. Suddenly, a terrible roar pierces the din.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Night Fury! Get down! Toothless bounds over the crowd and BLASTS a hole through chain enclosure. He flies through it and disappears in th boiling smoke. The Vikings rush to railings... in time to see a flurry o wings cutting through the dissipating smoke. Toothless an the Nightmare tumble into the clear, locked in a toothy, vicious fight. Toothless kicks the Nightmare off and plan himself between Hiccup and it. The Nightmare snarls, circling them. Toothless lunges and ROARS... causing the Nightmare to relent and back away. To everyone's shock and horror, Hiccup gets to his feet a grabs Toothless protectively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, Toothless, go. Get out of here! The crowd is gob-smacked, growing livid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Night Fury!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010 Hiccup tries to shoo Toothless away in vain. Vikings begi pouring clambering through the enclosure and dropping int the ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go! GO!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it alive! Stoick grabs an axe and charges into the arena. Astrid ca out to him, panicked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stoick no!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad! No! He won't hurt you! The other Vikings surround and attack Toothless. He tosse them aside like rag dolls, his eyes focused on Stoick.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No, don't! You're only making it worse! Stoick raises his hammer as he charges for Toothless. Toothless ducks and pounces on him. They tumble end over

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Toothless! STOP! He pins Stoick and inhales. The familiar hiss of gas buil Everyone braces...

dialogues.speaker: NO
dialogues.text: Toothless swallows back the blast and turns to Hiccup, no understanding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get him! The crowd rushes him, piling on, and taking Toothless dow Astrid holds Hiccup back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Please...just don't hurt him. Please don't hurt him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010 Stoick gets to his feet, fuming, shaken. A Viking present Stoick with an axe. He eyes Toothless a moment, then push the axe back into the Viking's hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put it with the others! His burning glare turn to Hiccup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Being shoved into the dank, dimmed hall. SLAM! The massive doors rattle and echo. Stoick pushes pa him. He paces against a backdrop of shadowy tapestries an carved pillars -- a legacy of heroes, all peering down in angered judgement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should have known. I should have seen the signs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We had a deal! Stoick pauses to say something, but stops short. He SNORT and resumes pacing, repeating the cycle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know we did... but that was before... ughh, it's all so messed up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So everything in the ring. A trick? A lie? He stomps toward Hiccup. Stops short and points, fighting back words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I screwed up. I should have told you before now. Take this out on me, be mad at me, but please... just don't hurt Toothless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dragon? That's what you're worried about? Not the people you almost killed?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was just protecting me! He's not dangerous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've killed HUNDREDS OF US!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we've killed THOUSANDS OF THEM! They defend themselves, that's all! They raid us because they have to! If they don't bring enough food back, they'll be eaten themselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's something else on their island dad...it's a dragon like-- Stoick HUFFS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Their island? He stomps back... pointing an accusing finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you've been to the nest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I say nest? Hiccup goes silent -- he said too much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you find it?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... I didn't. Toothless did. Only a dragon can find the island. Stoick GLARES. A moment passes, then an idea takes form o his face. His eyes flare. Hiccup watches, realizing. Stoi stomps toward the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh no. No, Dad. No. Hiccup chases after him, panicked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Dad. It's not what you think. You don't know what you're up against. It's like nothing you've ever seen. He grabs Stoick by the arm, tugging with all his might. H has no effect whatsoever.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Dad. Please. I promise you that you can't win this one. Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No. Dad. No. For once in your life,

dialogues.speaker: ME
dialogues.text: He throws Hiccup off of him, SWATTING him to the floor. Icy stillness. Hiccup stares back, stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've thrown your lot in with them. You're not a Viking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not my son. Stoick pushes through the door, leaving Hiccup alone, devastated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready the ships!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stoick staggers on the steps, breaking inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Broken-down catapults and trebuchets are bundled up and lowered from the cliffs. Below on the docks, Vikings load the heavy artillery into hulls of awaiting ships. Children and the elderly gather on the walkways to wave apprehensive farewells to the departing warriors. Lastly, Toothless is loaded aboard Stoick's ship, chained down to a palette, muzzled, and restrained with a weighty neck ring. He looks exhausted, miserable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010 Stoick crosses to the bow as the ship pushes off and join the amassed armada of ships adrift in the harbor. Stoick's brow is furrowed, all warmth drained away. He tu west and glares at the horizon with cold determination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Set sail! We head for Helheim's Gate. He then notices HICCUP watching from his familiar cliff-s perch beyond the village. Their eyes meet, full of hurt a regret. Hiccup slowly shakes his head in warning. Stoick breaks the stare and turns to Toothless, fuming.

dialogues.speaker: STOICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Lead us home, Devil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watching. He's powerless to stop what is happening, but w leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still standing there. The ships have cleared the horizon. CRANE UP to reveal Astrid is standing behind him. She approaches cautiously and stands beside him in silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a mess. Hiccup doesn't respond.

dialogues.speaker: ASTRID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You must feel horrible. You've lost everything. Your father, your tribe, your best friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for summing that up.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why couldn't I have killed that dragon when I found him in the woods. It would have been better for everyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep. The rest of us would have done it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So why didn't you? Hiccup just shakes his head - he really doesn't know. Astrid's eyes glimmer. She wants something.

dialogues.speaker: ASTRID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why didn't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I couldn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not an answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is this so important to you all of a sudden?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I want to remember what you say right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angry, loud) Oh for the love of -- I was a coward! I was weak. I wouldn't kill a dragon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said 'wouldn't' that time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever! I wouldn't! Three hundred years and I'm the first Viking who wouldn't kill a dragon! A BEAT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First to ride one, though. Hiccup blinks. He never looked at it that way before.

dialogues.speaker: ASTRID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I wouldn't kill him because he looked as frightened as I was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I looked at him and I saw myself. Astrid turns to face the open sea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet he's really frightened now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going to do about it? Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably something stupid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. But you've already done that. Another beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then something crazy. Astrid smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's more like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The armada coasts toward a shroud of heavy fog, hung like drapes from a low-hanging, ominous sky. The ships enter, one by one. Visibility drops immediately Flanking ships becomes ghosts. The armada disappears, dra into the blinding mist. Complete whiteout. Nothing remain but the eerie creaking of wood on water. ON STOICK at the bow of his ship. He taps his fingers on gunwale, then looks back at Toothless impatiently. Weighe down with chains, Toothless seems unresponsive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sound your positions. Stay within earshot. Shouts pour in from all directions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One length to your stern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On your starboard flank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three widths to port.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahead, at your bow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haven't a clue. ON STOICK straining into the fog as the calls continue. Massive, jagged sea stacks begin to emerge, threatening t rip the ships to shreds. Gobber approaches him, speaking under his breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen... Stoick... I was overhearing some of the men just now and, well, some of them are wondering what it is we're up to here -- not me of course, I know you're always the man with the plan -- but some, not me, are wondering if there is in fact a plan at all, what it might be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find the nest and take it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah. Of course. Send them running. The old Viking fall-back. Nice and simple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhh. Stoick notices that Toothless' ear plates are at the aler quietly reacting to inaudible sounds. Stoick crosses to the stern of the ship and grabs the til moving the helmsman out of the way.

dialogues.speaker: STOICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Step aside. Stoick pulls the ship into a turn, covertly following Toothless' head movements.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010 The ship barely misses a jagged outcrop that suddenly app out of the soupy fog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bear to port. The order is called out from ship to ship. CRUNCH! The bow barely makes it past another sea stack. Stoick continues to follow Toothless' cues, undeterred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hiccup raises the bolt on the Monstrous Nightmare's pen.

dialogues.speaker: FISHLEGS, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: If you're planning on getting eaten, I'd definitely go with the Gronckle. Hiccup turns to see his fellow recruits, watching him wit folded arms. Tuffnut steps forward with a scowl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were wise to seek help from the world's most deadly weapon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love this plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So? What is the plan? Hiccup smiles, glowing in the support of his friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ships follow in line through the gauntlet of rocks as orders are whispered from ship to ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010 A dragon head looms out of the fog. The men recoil... onl discover that it's a wrecked ship, impaled high on a gnar sea stack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah. I was wondering where that went. A clicking buzz becomes audible, growing louder. It fills sky, converging in one general direction. Stoick sniffs t air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay low and ready your weapons. Stoick's ship suddenly JERKS to a halt as the keel burrow into shallow black sand. Stoick hops overboard, landing on a sprawling beach. The BUZZING suddenly STOPS. Above him, a craggy volcano tower into the gloom.

dialogues.speaker: STOICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We're here. Behind him, several dragon-headed bows pierce the fog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hiccup steps back from the door, drawing the Monstrous Nightmare out of its cave. It snorts, stepping into the r calmed by Hiccup's outstretched hand -- focused on him. ON THE TEENS... bewildered, in awe. Snotlout nervously reaches for a spear laying near his fo Astrid stops him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-uh. Hiccup slows to a stop in front of the teens, with the Nightmare inches from his outstretched hand. He reaches over and grabs Snotlout's trembling hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait! What are you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax. It's okay... it's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010 Hiccup replaces his outstretched hand with Snotlout's, putting him in control of the massive beast. The Nightmar snorts, but remains calm. Snotlout, by contrast, chuckles nervously -- it's at once terrifying and amazing. The others watch, spellbound. Hiccup turns and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going?! Hiccup pulls a bundle of rope from a supply box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to need something to help you hold on. The teens eye each other apprehensively, and look up to reveal... ALL THE DRAGONS standing in the ring, facing the teens expectantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tree trunks, being sharpened and planted into the sand at angled rows. Boulders being loaded into catapult baskets. And a war plan being scratched in the sand. STOICK looms over it, looking determined. His generals ar at his sides.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When we crack this mountain open, all hell is going to break loose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In my undies. Good thing I brought extras. Stoick TURNS to face the men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No matter how this ends, it ends today. He walks toward the base of the volcano wall, back by sev hundred warriors. He raises his arm and drops it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010 A line of catapults UNLEASH their two-ton loads into the cliff wall. It cracks and flakes away. Several more hits tear away at the hollow shell of harden lava. A final boulder shatters the fractured wall, creating a d dark opening to the cavern within. Silence. Stock raises his hand, makes a gesture. A flamin bushel is launched into the dark, lighting the wall... CH WITH DRAGONS. Stoick pulls his hammer and rushes into the cave, brazen.

dialogues.speaker: STOICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (War cries and slashing efforts) In a chaotic flurry, the dragons suddenly rush out like b from a cave. The take to the air, bypassing the axe-swing Vikings and fleeing the island in a mass exodus. The battle-ready Vikings drop their weapons, confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that it? Above the island, dragons POUR from every crevice, fleein the sky. The sound of screeching dragons fades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Cheering as one)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've done it! Stoick doesn't celebrate. Something is not right. He HEAR something. Stoick turns to peer down the dark throat of t cavern. A deep, rumbling ROAR echoes from the cavern. The ground underfoot TREMBLES. The ships rock. Their sails fill with blast of air. The cheering stops. Stoick's expression sinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't over. Form your ranks! Hold together! The men SCRAMBLE to organize themselves.

dialogues.speaker: STOICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Get clear!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010 The ground CRACKS. Stone tears away, cascading like an avalanche. And through the settling debris, the silhouett a gargantuan dragon emerges -- THE RED DEATH. Stirred and furious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beard of Thor...what is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Odin help us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catapults! The Vikings score direct hits. The burning stones BOUNCE the dragon's skin. The Red Death focuses on the catapults It crushes the first one - smashing it and its crew, ratt the beach underfoot. Stoick races toward the second catapult. He LEAPS and pus a Viking out of the way just before the dragon crushes hi under his forepaw. The Vikings scramble in all directions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get to the ships!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! NO! The Red Death BLASTS the ships like a mile-long flamethro The sails are torched. Vikings dive overboard and masts c down. Gobber Joins Stoick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heh. Smart, that one. Stoick looks up and down the beach for an answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was a fool. The monster raises its head to the sky and BELLOWS. The sound SHAKES the beach, knocking Vikings off their feet. This island is his. Stoick stops a Viking General.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010

dialogues.speaker: STOICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Lead the men to the far side of the island.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. (turns to the others) Everybody to the far side of the island! The Vikings scatter into the rocks like ants. Satisfied w the ships destruction, The Red Death turns its attention to the Vikings. They seem to have vanished. It SNIFFS the air, searching for their scent. Gobber drops in beside Stoick, like two soldiers in a tre Fire blasts over head, causing them to duck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gobber, go with the men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I'll stay, just in case you're thinking of doing something crazy. Stoick grabs him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can buy them a few minutes if I give that thing someone to hunt. Gobber removes Stoick's hand. Clenches his forearm, determined.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I can double that time. Stoick grins. Friends to the bitter end. They BREAK COVER dash into the open, SPLITTING UP. Stoick rips a sharpened post from the ground and hurls it into the monster's face

dialogues.speaker: NO, HERE
dialogues.text: It spots both of them. He fuels up to fire, glancing back forth between the two men. He focuses on Stoick.

dialogues.speaker: GOBBER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come on! Fight me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, me! The Red Death remains focused on Stoick - this is it. It rears back and inhales. Gas begins to amass, when... KABLAM! A BLAST explodes against the back of The Red Deat head. It turns distracted, as... ... a Nadder punches through the flames, banking across t sky. Followed by a Monstrous Nightmare, a Zippleback, and Gronckle. They roll in unison, revealing the recruits rid on their backs. Hiccup leads, with Astrid clinging to his waist. GOBBER AND STOICK, watch slack-jawed, in awe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruff, Tuff, watch your backs! Move Fishlegs! The monster shakes off the blast and snaps in their wake. Hiccup directs his squadron out of harm's way. They climb of reach and circle each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at us, we're on a dragon! We're on dragons, all of us!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up, let's move it! The dragons climb past the Red Death.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE GROUND
dialogues.text: Gobber hobbles over to Stoick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every bit the boar-headed, stubborn Viking you ever were. Stoick is speechless.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE AIR
dialogues.text: The group circles over the dragon's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fishlegs, break it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Heavily armored skull and tail made for bashing and crushing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steer clear of both. Small eyes, large nostrils. Relies on hearing and smell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Lout, Legs, hang in its blind spot. Make some noise, keep it confused. Ruff, Tuff, find out if it has a shot limit. Make it mad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my specialty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since when? Everyone knows I'm more irritating. See.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just do what I told you. I'll be back as soon as I can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, we got it covered!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah! Hiccup and Astrid peel away. The teens bank and dive towa the monster, splitting up. The Twins race alongside the monster's head, taunting it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Troll!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butt Elf!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bride of Grendel! The Red Death unloads a spray of fire at the twins. They barely dodge it. Fishlegs and Snotlout hang behind its eyes, banging away their shields, making a racket. The Red Death opens all SIX of its eyes, spotting them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, this thing doesn't have a blind spot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010

dialogues.speaker: ON HICCUP AND ASTRID
dialogues.text: ... searching for Toothless. Hiccup spots him among the burning ships.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There! He steers the Nadder over the deck and hands Astrid the reins. He lines up his jump... and hops off, guarding his face from the flames. He lands on the burning deck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go help the others! She and the Nadder take off. As Hiccup fights his way to Toothless. He unbuckles the muzzle. Toothless shrieks.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay, hold on. Hold on. He gets to work on the chains.

dialogues.speaker: ON SNOTLOUT AND FISHLEGS
dialogues.text: They clang their weapons against their shields, making th monster wince.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's working. The huge beast starts to sway its head dizzily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah! It's working. PAN DOWN to reveal that the noise is also confusing the Gronckle and the Monstrous Nightmare. Both dragons lose t bearings. The Red Death thrashes, knocking Snotlout off of his drag and onto the monster's gigantic head. Snotlout bounces ac the top and comes to a stop just shy of the hundred foot drop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agghh! Fishlegs' Gronckle goes down in a spin of confusion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've lost power on the Gronckle. Snotlout! Do something! He hurls Snotlout his hammer. The Gronkle crashes and ski to a stop...

dialogues.speaker: FISHLEGS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm okay! ... then flips over, crushing Fishlegs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Less okay.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SNOTLOUT
dialogues.text: ... who eyes the Red Death's gigantic, veiny eyes. He rai the hammer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't miss! ... and hammers the monster's eyes, playing whack-a-mole.

dialogues.speaker: SNOTLOUT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What's wrong buddy, got something in your eye? Astrid flies by on her Nadder, catching Snotlout in all h heroics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah! You're the Viking! Snotlout grins, finally vindicated in her eyes. In his distraction, he gets thrown and lands heavily on one of t Red Death's spines -- clinging precariously. A close call

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa!

dialogues.speaker: ON THE GROUND
dialogues.text: The monster's tail sweeps across the burning ships, snapp masts like twigs. We follow one down as it crashes onto a deck, revealing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Working at the chains. He can't budge them. Fire licks at clothes. He looks up to see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010 THE RED DEATH blasting at the teens, enraged. The monster's giant foot crashes through frame, smashing bow under its impressive weight. Hiccup and Toothless are thrown into the water in a maels of burning planks and rigging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hiccup swims toward Toothless. They're both caught in a m of rigging, being dragged down. The heavy palette settles into the rocky bottom like an anchor. Toothless has stopp struggling. Hiccup takes one more hopeless tug at the cha he's almost out of air. Suddenly, a meaty hand grabs Hiccup. STOICK explodes to the surface, pulling Hiccup to the shoreline through flaming debris. He lays him down, under shelter of an overhanging rock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad... Stoick dives back into the water between flaming flotsam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON TOOTHLESS, drowning. Stoick appears in front of him. Toothless freezes. Stoick tears the chains off of the yok and lets it float free. Momentary stillness. They eye each other, through the chu up bubbles. Toothless lunges out of the bars -- grabbing Stoick. BOOM! In an explosion of sea water, Toothless lands on th shore, setting Stoick down and releasing him. Hiccup is a The ground rumbles underfoot. The monster screeches. Its massive claws stomp around in the smoke. Stoick gives way as Toothless mounts the rock and raises wings. He turns to Hiccup and SNORTS - Let's go.'

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You got it, bud. Hiccup climbs onto Toothless and buckles himself in. Stoick grabs his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hiccup. I'm sorry...for everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...me too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to go up there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're Vikings. It's an occupational hazard. They exchange smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm proud to call you my son. Hiccup beams, taken aback.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks dad. Stoick lets go of Hiccup's arm. Hiccup spurs Toothless on, charged with his father's beli in him. They rocket into the sky as Stoick watches.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE AIR
dialogues.text: Astrid sees Toothless streaking through the sky, gaining altitude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's up! She turns to Ruffnut and Tuffnut, who are ARGUING and THROWING PUNCHES at each other.

dialogues.speaker: ASTRID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Get Snotlout out of there! IN MID-PUNCH, the twins look over to see Snotlout strande the monster's head. They eye each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm on it! I'm on it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm on it first! I'm ahead of you. The twins spot Snotlout on the giant dragon and steer the Zippleback in his direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Let me drive! The twins peel off, ARGUING as they race each other to th monster. Snotlout sees the Zippleback diving toward him and DASHES down the Red Death's head. He runs up the end of its horn As the twins sweep past, both missing him... but perfectl snatching him where the necks merge. Ruff and Tuff eye ea other, surprised and impressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe that worked. The Red Death spots Astrid and INHALES, preparing to blas She and her Nadder get caught in the suction, pulled towa the monster's gaping mouth.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE GROUND
dialogues.text: The Vikings watch with dread. They hear the familiar whir the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Night Fury! Get down!

dialogues.speaker: IN THE AIR
dialogues.text: A massive BLAST jolts the Red Death's head sideways. Astr is thrown clear of its mouth... AND her Nadder. She tumbl through the air. The ground races toward her, when... She's suddenly CAUGHT by the leg. She looks up to see Toothless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you get her? Toothless grunts.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE GROUND
dialogues.text: They fly over the crowd of Vikings and set Astrid down, m run. They circle back to reengage - a black speck against clouds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010 Hiccup and Toothless rocket past the Red Death's head and climb, higher and higher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That thing has wings! Okay, let's see if it can use them! Hiccup pulls Toothless into a turn. They plummet, gaining tremendous speed. The wind buffets them as they target th Red Death as super sonic speed. KABLAM! Toothless unloads a fireball against the Red Deat head. It goes down with a rumble as they climb anew.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE GROUND
dialogues.text: The Vikings shield themselves from the dust of the fallen monster... as its wings unfold and extend.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE AIR
dialogues.text: Hiccup looks back as they put distance between them.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do you think that did it? Suddenly, the enraged behemoth RISES into frame... flappi its wings furiously. A daunting sight.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Well, he can fly. Hiccup and Toothless DIVE into the tangled sea stacks - t weave through the rock like rabbits through a briar. The Death SNAPS at them, but cannot reach them. Hiccup and Toothless PULL AHEAD. The Red Death SMASHES through the canopy of rock and pull behind Toothless. He BURSTS THROUGH fifty-foot formations like they were saplings.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE GROUND
dialogues.text: Stoick, Gobber, and the Teens watch as Hiccup and Toothle streak past, weaving through sea stacks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woohoo! Yeah! A moment later the Red Death SMASHES the sea stacks to du in hot pursuit. The Vikings mood is quenched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010 Hiccup and Toothless can't slow the monster down. Hiccup the clouds above. An idea hits him. He locks eyes with Toothless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay Toothless, time to disappear. Toothless PULLS into a steep climb, heading toward the clouds.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come on bud! The Red Death follows, closing in fast.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (hearing the gas) Here it comes! BLAST! They narrowly dodge a column of flame and smoke. T reach the low-hanging clouds and pierce them. The monster follows, immediately losing them in the hampered visibili It roars irritably. From out of nowhere, Toothless DIVES at the huge dragon, BLASTING and PUNCTURING a hole in its wing. Toothless and Hiccup are gone again before the dragon can get a shot at them.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE GROUND
dialogues.text: The Vikings stare up at the sky listening to the resoundi BOOMS and watching FLASHES light up the clouds. Gobber places a hand on Stoick's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE AIR
dialogues.text: HICCUP and TOOTHLESS dive in again and again, using the clouds to hide and surprise as they puncture the monster' wings. It BELLOWS in frustration and WHIRLS around, unleashing f blindly, in all directions. Hiccup sees the glow of fire cutting towards them.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Watch out! The random blast CLIPS Toothless' tail. It's heavily dama

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay, time's up. Let's see if this works. He pulls Toothless into a turn. They fly directly into th Red Death's face, taunting it.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come on! Is that the best you can do!? Toothless utters an insult too, and they jackknife into a steep dive. The Red Death pursues. Toothless PUMPS his wings, racing faster than he's ever g before. Hiccup and Toothless stay just ahead of the Red D -- no longer trying to evade it. Hiccup glances back to check the tail - it's disintegrati

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Stay with me buddy. We're good. Just a little bit longer. The Red Death closes the gap. Hiccup tucks in and holds Toothless steady -- allowing the monster to set its sight them. It narrows its eyes.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hold, Toothless. The Red Death OPENS his mouth. The familiar gas HISS eman from his throat -- ignition is coming.

dialogues.speaker: NOW
dialogues.text: Hiccup HITS the PEDALS HARD as Toothless extends one wing They PIVOT in place, hurtling directly into the Red Death mouth. Toothless FIRES point blank down the monster's throat. It amassing gas is ignited, BACKFIRING into the monster, erupting in a chain of blasts throughout its body. Hiccup and Toothless BURST from the clouds, the Red Death on their tail, exploding from within. It glances forward sees the ground rushing up. It throws open its wings, attempting to put on the brakes, but the punctured, damag wings can't stop its momentum. As the Red Death chokes on the expanding fireball, he see Toothless suddenly pull out of the dive, streaking up, pa its head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010 The Red Death HITS the ground, head-first. It EXPLODES li the Hindenburg. Hiccup and Toothless weave through the monster's massive plates, wings, and flailing legs -- a high-speed recall o the FREE FALL slalom run. The expanding fireball races to them, about to swallow them. They manage to clear the obstacles. Hiccup glances back. They're outrunning the fireball. He looks forward just in time to see the monster's massiv club tail careening toward them. He tries to shift their direction. The last shreds of Toothless' tail tear away. Hiccup's pedals go DEAD.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No. No. Hiccup and Toothless can't maneuver - they're dead in the air. The giant club tail CLIPS Toothless, TEARING Hiccup the harness and sending him tumbling against the backdrop the fast-approaching fireball. Toothless STRUGGLES with all his might to reach the unconscious Hiccup. But the fireball swallows them both.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE GROUND
dialogues.text: The Vikings watch in horror as Hiccup and Toothless disap into the boiling inferno.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A whiteout of ash. And through it comes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hiccup? Hiccup!? Stoick appears, searching desperately. Everything is scorched. Even the ground is smoking from the terrible he

dialogues.speaker: STOICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hiccup!? Son!? Through the ash, Stoick the motionless silhouette of Toothless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hiccup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010 He hurries to the dragon's side. Toothless is roughed up, conscious. His scorched saddle, however, is vacant. Stoick looks to the sky in despair. He buckles at the kne overwhelmed by the loss.

dialogues.speaker: STOICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh son...I did this... Astrid pushes through the crowd, her eyes welling up. Followed by Gobber. They flank Stoick as he kneels, slump over. Behind them, a ring of Vikings form, keeping a respectful distance. As the dust and smoke clear, a ring of wild dragons can also be seen, gathering just behind and betwe the Vikings. Toothless stirs and groggily rolls his head toward Stoick Their eyes meet.

dialogues.speaker: STOICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry... Toothless unfolds his wings, revealing Hiccup, unconsciou clutched safely against his chest. Stoick's eyes widen.

dialogues.speaker: STOICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hiccup. He scoops Hiccup into his arms. Listens to his heart. Bur into relieved laughter.

dialogues.speaker: STOICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He's alive!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You brought him back alive! The crowd roars. Followed by the dragons. The Vikings loo around to find themselves surrounded. Stoick leans close to Toothless, meeting him eye to eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you... for saving my son. Gobber looks Hiccup up and down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you know... most of him. Stoick glances back at him. Gobber shrugs, redirecting hi eyes toward...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HICCUP, asleep, his head on a pillow. Healing scars on hi face show that maybe a week or two have passed. Toothless hovers over him, WHINING and GRUMBLING impatien Hiccup stirs. Opens his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hey Toothless. Toothless excitedly nuzzles and nudges Hiccup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay! I'm happy to see you too, bud. Now just-- Toothless steps on his groin, causing Hiccup to sit BOLT UPRIGHT with a YELP. He looks around, confounded. He's in his bed, moved besid the fire pit on the main floor of his house.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm in my house. (re: Toothless, leaning over him, excited) You're in my house. Toothless TEARS around the room, knocking things over, fa too big for the space.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Uh...does my dad know you're in here?! Toothless pauses at the foot of the bed, tongue wagging. eyes the rafters... and LEAPS UP onto them, brimming with 'happy dog' energy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay -- no Toothless! Aw, come on... Hiccup shifts to get out of bed... then pauses... sensing that something is wrong. He peels back the covers slowly. What he sees startles, horrifies, and overwhelms him -- all at once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010

dialogues.speaker: ON THE BARE FLOOR
dialogues.text: His booted foot touches down. Followed by a mechanical prosthetic in place of his second leg. It's an ingenious spring-loaded replacement, made of wood and iron. Toothless lands by the bed and approaches calmly, sniffin the new leg. He raises his eyes to meet Hiccup's, seeming aware of what Hiccup is going through. Hiccup braces himself on the bedpost and tries to stand o it. He winces and stifles the pain...

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay...okay... ... but STUMBLES with the first step. Toothless catches Hiccup's fall with his head... and slowly lifts him up, stabilizing him.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Thanks bud. Hiccup leans on him like a crutch. They take a few steps together. Their missing parts form a poetic silhouette as they make their way toward the door. Hiccup pries it open (as he did in the opening scene), revealing a MONSTROUS NIGHTMARE flapping outside the door Hiccup YELPS and slams the door closed. He turns to Toothless, alarmed.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Toothless? Stay here, bud. Hiccup pauses... and cracks the door open again. He peeks outside, his eyes widening. He allows to door to swing op revealing... ... the Monstrous Nightmare, carrying Snotlout on its bac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on guys, get ready! Hold on tight! Here we go! A class of newbie dragon riders follow him through frame variety of dragons, pulling back the curtain on an amazin vista in which:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010 Vikings and dragons mill about by the dozen, basking on t rooftops, weaving along the plaza. No one seems upset, th isn't a sword in sight. Under the framework of a MASSIVE BARN, a Nadder BLASTS fi onto a metal brace. It steps back to let a Viking hammer into shape. Nearby, a Gronkle lands, carrying a tree trun his mouth. He shows a Viking what he's found. The Viking his head. Another Viking backs a Zippleback into a stall check it for size. Hiccup takes a step outside, finding Stoick waiting for h on the step.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew it. I'm dead. Stoick laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but you gave it your best shot. He puts his arm around Hiccup, steadying him. He gestures the transformed village.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So? What do you think? Hiccup just shrugs, amazed. Below, the plaza, villagers take notice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey look! It's Hiccup! They rush over, surrounding him with a hero's welcome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hiccup, how you doin' mate?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's great to see you up and about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turns out all we needed was a little more of...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just gestured to all of me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010

dialogues.speaker: GOBBER, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Well. Most of you. Gobber pushes through the crowd, beaming proudly.

dialogues.speaker: GOBBER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (re: the prosthetic leg) That bit's my handiwork. With a little Hiccup flare thrown in. Think it'll do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bittersweet, coming to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I might make a few tweaks. Astrid appears and jabs Hiccup in the arm. Hiccup recoils with a grumble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's for scaring me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, is it always going to be this way? Cause I... She grabs him aggressively... then kisses him. Hoots and hollers follow.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ... could get used to it. Gobber presents Hiccup with a rebuilt saddle, rigging, an tail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome home. Suddenly, Toothless pounces on the crowd, crushing severa unsuspecting Vikings under his weight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Night Fury, get down! Toothless eyes the new tail excitedly, tongue wagging. Am the groans and grumbles, Hiccup and Astrid exchange a sheepish grin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hiccup's prosthetic foot, snapping into the modified stir

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dragon" DeBlois/Sanders Final Draft (Rev.19) 02-13-2010 The two pieces click together, forming a single shape. Astride Toothless, he's whole again. He rotates the pedal The new tail opens. Bright red with a skull and Viking ho emblazoned on it. Hiccup approves. CUT BACK TO REVEAL... Hiccup and Toothless, saddled up and ready to fly. Astrid backs her Nadder into position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ready? Toothless SNORTS an excited 'yes!' From his mount, Hiccup looks out over the changed world.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: This... is Berk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It snows nine months of the year... and hails the other three. They LEAP into the bright blue sky, together as one. Astr follows, giving chase.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Any food that grows here is tough and tasteless. The people that grow here are even more so. Hiccup and Astrid race their dragons through the village under eaves, over rooftops, down cliff-sides, and between ship masts. It's a high energy, romantic dance of sorts.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The only upsides are the pets. While other places have...ponies or parrots, we have... Their fellow recruits join them as they take to the open rocketing far above the village. The Northern sky swirls blazing, multicolored dragons. Hiccup and Toothless break from the pack, spinning into t blinding sun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... dragons.
